scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You responded: 'I understand the urgency, but I am currently on leave. Can you ask someone else to take care of it?' [Monica] replied: 'I understand, but you're the only one who can handle this correctly. It's really important for the project.' You then responded: 'I can help out, but I need some time to get to a place where I can work on it.'
scenes.description: [Bob] says: 'I can't believe you couldn't handle it right away. We really needed you.'

options.text: I understand it's frustrating, but I also need to take care of myself to be effective when I return.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the frustration and explained your need for self-care, showing emotional control and balanced empathy.

options.text: I did my best given the circumstances. Maybe we can find a better way to handle such situations in the future.
options.analysis: You expressed understanding and offered a constructive suggestion for future improvements, showing empathy and motivation.

options.text: I think it's unfair to put all the responsibility on me when I'm on leave. We need a better backup plan.
options.analysis: You pointed out the unfairness and suggested a need for a better plan, showing social skills but lower empathy and emotional perception.
